title: MF changes aren't till after worlds, so that means over a month away?
body:
When is worlds and when is the season ending?

Will MF be patched before season 5 concludes?

replies.body:
The present plan is for MF's changes to come out with the pre-season (so after Worlds), as they require particle updates to her base and skins. 

Not to get everyone too excited, but we are also having to do a lot of performance testing to ensure that the number of bullets her ult fires at level 16 doesn't destroy min spec computers.

They always change identity of champions to the complete opposite when there is nothing wrong with what the champion does. Take Skarner for example, he used to be an inescapable duelist in S3, his weaknesses were being unable to get to people, weak early game pressure, and organized team fighting. Now he is the complete opposite, it's easy to escape Skarner, he's got mage movement speed and no perma slow/Q movement speed, not all champions escape super easy but over 50% of them have no issue escaping him 1v1, he's fucking slow. As for dueling, he is by far the weakest fighter in the game if he doesn't have his spires with him, bad duel potential, and his team fight, well now people who built tank are benefiting, hp stacking has given him a bigger shield even though it's CD is much much higher than it used to be (due to loss of energize) and so he is a team fighting tank focused on dragging carries. The entire idea behind the champion has been completely reversed to something much less fun.

Sion shared a simular fate, once a massive lifestealing monster, the king of hitting shit and never dieing, his weakness was being some what squishy so you could kill him in CC, now he is the one doing the CCing, as a CC tank (as if we didn't have 100 of those already) and his new weakness, well one of them, is high sustain duelists. He used to be the king of sustain, and now it's his fucking weakness since he doesn't have the damage to do shit to them.

I'm just tired of all the identity reversals in weakness, Riot could have created a shrine maiden champion for their Skarner passive idea, and could have buff one of the current CC tanks instead of changing Sion, but instead they just change an existing one people have already grown to like. It's easy to shrug it off when it's not your champion and the champion is one of the lowest pick rates, but for me, Skarner was a lot of fun, he was a champ I could enjoy and ignore my team looking for picks and shit, now he's a team fighting tank with terrible damage. I mean there is a reason I don't play Amumu or Malphite, why would I want Skarner to be like that?

Making a champion viable and able to be played takes the top priority I'd imagine. Yes it being fun is ALSO important, but look at it like this. If 1% of the playerbase plays and enjoys urgot, is it not better to aid another 9% of people who would play him if he were truly a decent pick? The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few. Sorry, just the way the world works.

Same thing for Skarner, people don't need current Skarner, he's just a gimmicky, lower damage Blitzcrank, however he used to be a great duelist, and unique, or at least as unique as champions get in this game.

My body is ready, my computer is not.
Hopefully she can move while casting it, or it won't matter how cool it looks. Right now she has one of the worst ults in the game.
Really? for the damage it deals it's pretty basic to be stationary to get countered; so what if it's directional or a cone? good positioning will get you a full ult on 3-5 people.

Good positioning by the enemy teams means MF never gets a full ult off in the first place, unless they're hard CCd. It's why she is rarely (if ever) picked in competitive play. Especially when a support with any form of hard CC can immediately interrupt her.
Not really any worse than Vel'koz. Sure, he can move his but as far as he can move his MF was already shooting there in the first place.
Not only can Velkoz move his, but it's further ranger, and it syncs with his knock up and slow very well. MF doesn't have hard CC to sync with her ult.

He only has 150 range on her, that's the distance of a melee attack. MF also has a slow. So the only thing he really has on her is a knock up. But remember that she's more likely to hit multiple targets at once, wider cone after all.

They're still similar in function though, which is my point.

her ults isnt amazing or anything. but its not terrible. in practice you find odd times to use it. like say enemies are low in health but its not quite safe to run up to them, or you dont have vision cause they went into bush or behind wall...odd stuff like that. it works.

Well, that's one way to help her, but what about the real problems? Any updates on those?

Her ult still having no AD Physical damage scaling making her core item, Black Cleaver, not any good on her, and her Q having been brought down from a glorious 180 degree arc to a puny 60 degree one.
